intro: Agathaea tricolor, commonly known as the three-colored agathaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes plants known for their milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its strikingly colored flowers, which typically feature three distinct hues on each petal. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a somewhat hairy texture. Agathaea tricolor is often grown for its ornamental value in gardens and is also of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure.
